title: Requires the division of criminal justice services and the chief administrator of the courts to track the number of crimes involving automated teller machines
summary: Requires the division of criminal justice services and the chief administrator of the courts to annually track the number of crimes involving automated teller machines.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2977

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 21, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced by M. of A. WRIGHT -- read once and referred to the Committee
         on Judiciary

       AN  ACT to amend the executive law and the judiciary law, in relation to
         requiring the division of criminal  justice  services  and  the  chief
         administrator of the courts to track automated teller machine crimes

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 837 of the executive law is amended by adding a new
    2  subdivision 4-d to read as follows:
    3    4-D. IN COOPERATION WITH THE CHIEF ADMINISTRATOR OF THE COURTS AS WELL
    4  AS ANY OTHER PUBLIC AGENCY, INCLUDING DISTRICT  ATTORNEYS,  COLLECT  AND
    5  ANALYZE  STATISTICAL  AND ALL OTHER INFORMATION AND DATA WITH RESPECT TO
    6  THE NUMBER OF CRIMES INVOLVING AUTOMATED TELLER MACHINES AS  DEFINED  BY
    7  SUBDIVISION  TWO OF SECTION SEVENTY-FIVE-B OF THE BANKING LAW LOCATED AT
    8  AUTOMATED TELLER MACHINE FACILITIES, AS DEFINED BY SUBDIVISION THREE  OF
    9  SECTION  SEVENTY-FIVE-B  OF THE BANKING LAW, REPORTED TO OR INVESTIGATED
   10  BY THE DIVISION OF STATE POLICE, AND ALL OTHER POLICE OR PEACE OFFICERS,
   11  THE NUMBER OF PERSONS ARRESTED FOR THE COMMISSION OF  SUCH  CRIMES,  THE
   12  CRIMES  FOR  WHICH  THE PERSON WAS ARRESTED, THE COUNTY WITHIN WHICH THE
   13  ARREST WAS MADE AND THE ACCUSATORY INSTRUMENT FILED, THE DISPOSITION  OF
   14  THE  ACCUSATORY  INSTRUMENT FILED, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, AS THE
   15  CASE MAY BE, DISMISSAL, ACQUITTAL, THE CRIMES  TO  WHICH  THE  DEFENDANT
   16  PLED  GUILTY, THE CRIMES THE DEFENDANT WAS CONVICTED OF AFTER TRIAL, AND
   17  THE SENTENCE IMPOSED. THE DIVISION  SHALL  INCLUDE  THE  STATISTICS  AND
   18  OTHER  INFORMATION  REQUIRED  BY  THIS  SUBDIVISION IN THE ANNUAL REPORT
   19  SUBMITTED TO THE GOVERNOR AND LEGISLATURE PURSUANT TO SUBDIVISION TWELVE
   20  OF THIS SECTION.
   21    S 2. Section 216 of the judiciary law  is  amended  by  adding  a  new
   22  subdivision 5 to read as follows:
   23    5.  THE  CHIEF  ADMINISTRATOR  OF  THE  COURTS  SHALL  COLLECT DATA IN
   24  RELATION TO THE NUMBER OF CRIMES  INVOLVING  AUTOMATED  TELLER  MACHINES

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD03795-01-1

       A. 2977                             2

    1  PURSUANT  TO SUBDIVISION FOUR-D OF SECTION EIGHT HUNDRED THIRTY-SEVEN OF
    2  THE EXECUTIVE LAW, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE  FOLLOWING  INFORMA-
    3  TION:
    4    (A) THE NUMBER OF CRIMES INVOLVING AUTOMATED TELLER MACHINES;
    5    (B) THE NUMBER OF PERSONS ARRESTED FOR THE COMMISSION OF SUCH CRIMES;
    6    (C) THE CRIMES ALLEGED;
    7    (D) THE COURT WHERE THE ACTION OR PROCEEDING WAS INSTITUTED;
    8    (E) THE DISPOSITION; AND
    9    (F) IN THE CASE OF DISMISSAL, THE REASONS THEREFOR.
   10    IN EXECUTING THIS REQUIREMENT, THE CHIEF ADMINISTRATOR MAY ADOPT RULES
   11  REQUIRING   APPROPRIATE  LAW  ENFORCEMENT,  CRIMINAL  JUSTICE  AGENCIES,
   12  DISTRICT ATTORNEYS  AND  COURTS  TO  IDENTIFY  ACTIONS  AND  PROCEEDINGS
   13  INVOLVING  ORDERS  OF  PROTECTION  AND, WITH RESPECT TO SUCH ACTIONS AND
   14  PROCEEDINGS, TO REPORT, IN SUCH FORM AND MANNER AS THE CHIEF ADMINISTRA-
   15  TOR SHALL PRESCRIBE, THE INFORMATION SPECIFIED IN THIS SUBDIVISION.
   16    S 3. This act shall take effect on the one hundred twentieth day after
   17  it shall have become a law; provided that the chief administrator of the
   18  courts is authorized to promulgate any and all rules and regulations and
   19  take any other measures necessary to implement this act on its effective
   20  date on or before such date.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the executive law and the judiciary law, in relation to requiring the division of criminal justice services and the chief administrator of the courts to track automated teller machine crimes
